benchmark_details.name: CogMath (Cognitive Mathematical Assessment)
benchmark_details.overview: CogMath is a comprehensive evaluation framework that assesses large language modelsâ€™ mathematical abilities through three cognitive stages and nine dimensions, inspired by human reasoning processes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the authentic mathematical capabilities of LLMs through a detailed cognitive framework.

data.source: CogMath was applied to three benchmarks: GSM8K, MATH, and a newly created MExam dataset composed of real exam questions.
data.size: 6,353 questions from MExam, 5,000 questions from MATH, 1,319 questions from GSM8K

methodology.calculation: The pass rate for each LLM is calculated based on their performance in nine evaluation dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: A higher pass rate indicates better mastery of mathematical problem-solving abilities.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 achieved 39.3% on MATH and 67.1% on GSM8K under CogMath assessment.
